name: Anthracnose
description: Anthracnose is a serious fungal disease that affects many fruits, vegetables, and plants such as mango, chili, tomato, beans, and grapes. It causes dark, sunken, rotten spots on fruits, leaves, and stems. The disease spreads fast in warm and wet climate and can cause heavy crop loss.
symptoms: Dark brown or black sunken spots on fruits

early_stage.description: Small, dark, water-soaked spots appear on leaves or fruits. The spots slowly grow in size.

middle_stage.description: The spots become larger, darker, and clearly sunken. The infected tissue starts to die.

advanced_stage.description: The infected part becomes fully rotten and unfit for use. Secondary infections may occur.

causes: The disease is caused by Colletotrichum fungus. It spreads through infected seeds, plant waste, rain splash, wind, insects, and farm tools.

favorable_conditions.environment: Warm, wet, and poorly ventilated fields

impact.economic_impact: Causes heavy loss to farmers due to fruit rotting and reduced market value

diagnosis.field_diagnosis: Based on visible dark, sunken lesions on fruits and leaves
diagnosis.laboratory_diagnosis: Microscopic examination and fungal culture test

prevention: Remove and destroy infected plant parts

chemical_control: Spray recommended fungicides like Mancozeb or Carbendazim
cultural_control: Avoid wetting leaves and fruits while watering

resistant_varieties: Some disease-resistant varieties are available depending on the crop.
life_cycle: The fungus survives in plant debris and soil. It spreads during rain and infects new plants. It produces spores that spread the disease again and again in one season.

dataset_metadata.intended_use: Machine learning training, research, and educational purpose
